name: Argonaut Profile for Care Plan
publisher: FHIR project on behalf of Project Argonaut
description: A simple profile for care plan - text only, and critical supporting data

element.name: argonaut
element.definition: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.
The logical id of the resource, as used in the url for the resoure. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.definition: This records identifiers associated with this care plan that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).
element.requirements: Need to allow connection to a wider workflow.

element.definition: Identifies the patient/subject whose intended care is described by the plan.
element.requirements: Care plans are associated with the patient the plan is for.

element.definition: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now just historical record.
element.requirements: Allows clinicians to determine whether the plan is actionable or not.

binding.name: CarePlanStatus
binding.description: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now just historical record.

mapping.map:
.statusCode
planned = new
active = active
completed = completed

element.definition: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.
element.comments: Any activities scheduled as part of the plan should be constrained to the specified period.
element.requirements: Allows tracking what plan(s) are in effect at a particular time.

mapping.map: GOL-7-goal established date/time / GOL-8-expected goal achieve date/time

element.definition: Identifies the individual(s) or ogranization who is responsible for the content of the care plan.
element.comments: Collaborative care plans may have multiple authors.

element.definition: Identifies the most recent date on which the plan has been revised.
element.requirements: Indicates how current the plan is.

mapping.map: PTH-6-change pathway life cycle status date/time

element.definition: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans.  E.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", etc.
element.comments: There may be multiple axis of categorization and one plan may serve multiple purposes.  In some cases, this may be redundant with references to CarePlan.concern.
element.requirements: Used for filtering what plan(s) are retrieved and displayed to different types of users.

binding.name: CarePlanCategory
binding.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans.  E.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", etc.

element.definition: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.
element.requirements: Links plan to the conditions it manages.  Also scopes plans - multiple plans may exist addressing different concerns.

element.short: Information considered as part of plan
element.definition: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include co-morbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.
element.comments: Use "concern" to identify specific conditions addressed by the care plan.
element.requirements: Identifies barriers and other considerations associated with the care plan.

element.definition: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.
element.requirements: Allows representation of care teams, helps scope care plan.  In some cases may be a determiner of access permissions.

mapping.map: REL (REL.4 is always the Patient) ( or PRT?)

element.definition: Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care plan.  E.g. "Primary physician", "Team coordinator", "Caregiver", etc.
element.comments: Roles may sometimes be inferred by type of Practitioner.  These are relationships that hold only within the context of the care plan.  General relationships should be handled as properties of the Patient resource directly.

binding.name: CarePlanParticipantRole
binding.description: Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care plan.  E.g. "Primary physician", "Team coordinator", "Caregiver", etc.

element.definition: The specific person or organization who is participating/expected to participate in the care plan.
element.comments: Patient only needs to be listed if they have a role other than "subject of care".

mapping.map: REL.5 (or PRT-5-participation person : ( PRV-4 e {provider participations} ) / PRT-5-participation person : ( PRV-4 e {non-provider person participations} ) / PRT-5-participation person : ( PRV-4 = (patient non-subject of care) ) / PRT-8-participation organization?)

element.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the Care Plan.
element.comments: Goal can be achieving a particular change or merely maintaining a current state or even slowing a decline.
element.requirements: Provides context for plan.  Allows plan effectiveness to be evaluated by clinicians.

element.short: Action to occur as part of plan
element.definition: Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan.  For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.
element.requirements: Allows systems to prompt for performance of planned activities, validate plans against best practice.

element.definition: Resources that describe follow-on actions resulting from the plan, such as drug prescriptions, encounter records, appointments, etc.
element.requirements: Links plan to resulting actions.

element.definition: Notes about the execution of the activity.
element.comments: Doesn't describe the activity - that goes in details.
element.requirements: Can be used to capture information about adherence, progress, concerns, etc.

element.short: Activity details defined in specific resource
element.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.
element.requirements: Details in a form consistent with other applications and contexts of use.

element.definition: A simple summary of a planned activity suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.
element.requirements: Details in a simple form for generic care plan systems.

constraint.name: dose for food or drug
constraint.human: DailyDose can only be specified if activity category is drug or food

constraint.name: quantity for supply
constraint.human: Quantity can only be specified if activity category is supply

constraint.name: details by reference, or simple details
constraint.human: Only provide a detail reference, or a simple detail summary

element.short: diet | drug | encounter | observation | procedure | supply | other
element.definition: High-level categorization of the type of activity in a care plan.
element.requirements: May determine what types of extensions are permitted.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityCategory
binding.description: High-level categorization of the type of activity in a care plan.

element.definition: Detailed description of the type of planned activity.  E.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.
element.comments: Tends to be less relevant for activities involving particular products.  Codes should not convey negation - use "prohibited" instead.
element.requirements: Allows matching performed to planned as well as validation against protocols.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityType
binding.description: Detailed description of the type of activity.  E.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

mapping.map: OBR-4-universal service ID / RXE-2-Give Code / RXO-1-Requested Give Code / RXD-2-Dispense/Give Code

element.definition: Provides the health condition(s) or other rationale that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.
element.comments: Conditions can be identified at the activity level that are not identified as reasons for the overall plan.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityReason
binding.description: Identifies why a care plan activity is needed.  Can include any health condition codes as well as such concepts as "general wellness", prohylaxis, surgical preparation, etc.

element.definition: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.
element.requirements: So that participants know the link explicitly.

element.short: not-started | scheduled | in-progress | on-hold | completed | cancelled
element.definition: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.
element.comments: Some aspects of Status can be inferred based on the resources linked in actionTaken.  Note that "status" is only as current as the plan was most recently updated.
element.requirements: Indicates progress against the plan, whether the activity is still relevant for the plan.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityStatus
binding.description: Indicates where the activity is at in its overall life cycle

mapping.map:
.statusCode
not-started = new
scheduled = not-started (and fulfillment relationship to appointent)
in-progress = active
on-hold = suspended
completed = completed
cancelled = aborted

element.definition: Provides reason why the activity isn't yet started, is on hold, was cancelled, etc.
element.comments: Will generally not be present it status is "complete".  Be sure to prompt to update this (or at least remove the existing value) if the status is changed.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityStatusReason
binding.description: Describes why the current activity has the status it does.  E.g. "Recovering from injury" as a reason for non-started or on-hold, "Patient does not enjoy activity" as a reason for cancelling a planned activity

element.definition: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan.
element.requirements: Captures intention to not do something that may have been previously typical.

element.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.
element.requirements: Allows prompting for activities and detection of missed planned activities.

element.definition: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur.  E.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.
element.comments: May reference a specific clinical location or may just identify a type of location.
element.requirements: Helps in planning of activity.

element.definition: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.
element.comments: A performer MAY also be a participant in the care plan.
element.requirements: Helps in planning of activity.

mapping.map: PRT-5-participation person : ( PRV-4 e {provider participations} ) / PRT-5-participation person : ( PRV-4 e {non-provider person participations} ) / PRT-5-participation person : ( PRV-4 = (patient non-subject of care) ) / PRT-8-participation organization

element.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

mapping.map: RXE-2-Give Code / RXO-1-Requested Give Code / RXD-2-Dispense/Give Code

element.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day.
element.requirements: Allows rough dose checking.

mapping.map: RXO-23-total daily dose / RXE-19-total daily dose / RXD-12-total daily dose

element.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied, addministered or consumed by the subject.

mapping.map: RXO-11-requested dispense amount / RXE-10-dispense amount / RXD-4-actual dispense amount / RXG-5-give amount-minumum / RXA-6-administered amount /  TQ1-2.1-quantity.quantity  *and*  RXO-12-requested dispense units /  RXE-11-dispense units / RXD-5-actual dispense units / RXG-7-give units / RXA-7-administered units / TQ1-2.2-quantity.units

element.definition: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities.  It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions.  Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc.
General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.
element.requirements: Used to capture information that applies to the plan as a whole that doesn't fit into discrete elements.
